content.text:
# 2019 Manly Warringah Sea Eagles season

John Cartwright|next_season=2020|prev_season=2018|top_points= Reuben Garrick (194)|top_goals= Reuben Garrick (65)|top_tries= Reuben Garrick (16)|high_attendance=41,388 (vs Brisbane Broncos, round 9)|avg_attendance=13,777|stadium=Brookvale Oval (Lottoland)|captain2=|captain=Daly Cherry-Evans|coach= Des Hasler|league=NRL|CEO=Lyall Gorman|CEO_title=CEO|points_against=446|points_for=496|league_losses=10|league_draws=0|league_wins=14|playoff_result=|league_rank=6|league_champions=|list=}}The 2019 Manly-Warringah Sea Eagles season was the 70th in the club's history since their entry into the then New South Wales Rugby Football League premiership in 1947. The team came sixth in the regular season and qualified for the finals where they beat the Cronulla-Sutherland Sharks in an elimination final then lost to the South Sydney Rabbitohs in the semi-finals round.
